summary: The COVID-19 Military Backpay Act of 2025 provides remedies for members of the U.S. uniformed services discharged for not complying with the COVID-19 vaccination mandate. It allows covered members to file civil actions in the Court of Federal Claims, aiming for determinations of involuntary or unlawful discharge. If successful, the bill mandates monetary and other remedies, including compensation, service credit, reenlistment eligibility, and separation pay. Remedies are in addition to those from Executive Order 14184. The bill applies to pending claims.
